question: Can I afford a mortgage for a house costing $300,000 with a 5% interest rate, over 30 years?
true_answer: Yes, with a monthly payment of around $1,610, assuming no other significant debts.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage for a house costing $300,000 with a 5% interest rate, over 30 years?
Plan: 1) Calculate monthly payment using calculator. 2) Check typical affordability criteria. 3) Verify with supervisor if needed. 4) Provide final answer.
Calculating monthly payment for a $300,000 mortgage at 5% interest over 30 years.
Does this include taxes and insurance?
Retrieving knowledge on typical mortgage payments and inclusions.
Monthly payment estimate does not include taxes and insurance.
Retrieving knowledge on affordability criteria related to income and DTI.
Typically, housing expenses should not exceed 28% of your gross monthly income.
Your Debt-to-Income ratio including this mortgage should ideally be below 36%.
What would be a good income to support this mortgage?
Calculating required gross monthly income assuming 28% allocation for housing.
A gross monthly income of at least $5,750 would be recommended.
Yes, you can afford it if your monthly income is around $5,750. Payment is $1,610 excluding taxes and insurance.
